articles.description: Ollie Chessum will make his first England start in nearly a year after being named in the second row for Saturday's Calcutta Cup match against Scotland at Allianz Stadium.
articles.title: England team v Scotland: Ollie Chessum to make first Test start in nearly a year

articles.description: Novak Djokovic says the partnership with Andy Murray as his coach will continue "indefinitely".
articles.title: Andy Murray: Briton to continue working as Novak Djokovic's coach 'indefinitely'

articles.description: George Russell says he has "no intention" of speaking to Max Verstappen to clear the air following their row at the end of last season.
articles.title: George Russell has 'no intention' of speaking to Max Verstappen following row

articles.description: Everton fans get their first view inside the club's new ground at a Bramley-Moore Dock Stadium test event.
articles.title: Everton Stadium: 'It's out of this world' - Toffees fans get first glimpse of new stadium

articles.description: Jacksonville Jaguars wide receiver Louis Rees-Zammit says he has "never thought about" returning to play rugby union.
articles.title: NFL: Louis Rees-Zammit commits to Jaguars and 'never' considered rugby return

articles.description: Four venues, three leagues, more than six hours of football, almost 67,000 steps and all in less than 48 hours. One San Diego-based Spurs fan's manic weekend in London.
articles.title: US Tottenham superfan jets in for four matches in 48 hours

articles.description: Speaking ahead of the ATP Qatar Open, Novak Djokovic questions the fairness of the anti-doping system and says there is "favouritism" towards high-profile players.
articles.title: Jannik Sinner: It's time for us to address the anti-doping system - Djokovic

articles.description: Andrea Kimi Antonelli says the week before passing his driving test was "hell" as the 18-year-old looks ahead to his debut F1 season with Mercedes.
articles.title: Andrea Kimi Antonelli: Mercedes driver says week before passing his driving test was ‘hell’

articles.description: Jannik Sinner's case was "a million miles away from doping", says World Anti-Doping Agency general counsel Ross Wenzel.
articles.title: Jannik Sinner: Tennis world number one's case 'million miles away from doping', says Wada general counsel

articles.description: The Champions Trophy may feel like a tournament from a bygone age but it is crucial for England, who need to lift fans after a dark winter.
articles.title: Champions Trophy 2025: England need Brendon McCullum to bring back the smiles
